message: we are creating a group messaging app like convore. It's ment to be mobile, you can checkit out on a computer or your smartphone at http://misobb.com.
what differentiate us is that there's no login required.
native iphone app on it's way
How are you guys planning to handle spam on a public app like this?

we are thinking of letting the community regulate the discussion with a sort of time extension. When you create a new discussion you are the moderator of your discussion. Your discussion will have a 24h lifespan until someone participate in. One new message per discussion = + 24h of lifetime, something like that

jquery.mobile _is_ a very bad choice for now. Why? Because it's extremely slow and still alpha. I developed some tool for myself with jquery.mobile and I really regret it now :). I haven't tried out sencha touch, but it will be my next bet: http://www.sencha.com/products/touch
the web app is not the important part of the project, I just need a quick and dirty way to use what's under the hood : the API
at first I was disappointed by jquerymobile, but I like the fact that's it's very easy to learn. I havn't experience it's slowness. perhaps I will try senshatouch in another client linked to the API.
it's an open source project you can check the actual API here : https://github.com/misobb/noodle.js/wiki/Api
The spam issue is very soluble ... a clue, how do Google do it ;-)

Nope in web search ... dig into how Google got started, i.e. PageRank ... then think about how you apply the same algorithm to users. It’s actually pretty straightforward to spot spam users and spam-rings as it were.
good idea thanks for the advice
for those interested in node.js and mongoDB, feel free to look at the source at github
